interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2020/08/11
Average Rating: 4.5
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['J.C. Chandor'], 'Producers': ['Sean Akers', 'Robert Ogden Barnum', 'Michael Benaroya', 'Joshua Blum', 'Mishka Brown', 'Michael Corso', "Kirk D'Amico", 'Neal Dodson', 'Cassian Elwes'], 'Starring': ['Kevin Spacey', 'Paul Bettany', 'Jeremy Irons'], 'Studio': ['Lions Gate Films', 'Inc.']}
Review Text: This movie is a great illustration on what actually is going on with debt accounts here in the United States. Big companies don't want people to know that every debt gets resold for a profit and when it comes to things like huge debts such as student loans they get resold over, and over, and over again. Each time profiting someone who isn't the original debt owner or the original company responsible for lending the debt. This process is highly illegal and for those who can make it through the end of the movie can see exactly why. Eventually you get a total and utter economic collapse of the securities these debts are held under because of the fake money and inflation created from the sickening number of resales that have happened with the securities. Definitely up there with the Wolf of Wall street.
Review Title: A must watch for those in the business industry
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
